page.title: 06Churches in Shipton
page.content: Shipton Oliffe church is dedicated to St. Oswald and was founded at the end of the eleventh or beginning of the twelfth century.In 1776 the parishes of Shipton Oliffe and Shipton Sollars were united by the Bishop of Gloucester.As Shipton Oliffe grew in size and importance then the church there became more important than the church in Shipton Sollars:St. Mary's,which in the nineteenth century was disused.Its windows were blocked up and it was used as a farm store.One parishioner remembers sheep racks being stored in it and collecting eggs from the hens stray nests.In 1874 the church was restored under the direction of the Rector,but then it fell into disrepair again until 1930,when it was thoroughly restored and refurbished.
